page.title: 07KIRBY GRANGE FARM
page.content: This square kilometre is mostly covered by the farm.We had a great visit there the old lady was really helpful.The farm was once a dairy farm with 40 acres but the M1 motorway was built across alot of the land,only 14 acres remain.The farmhouse is 200 years old but the present owners came 20 years ago.They keep 6 livery horses,5 calves and some chickens.They grow their own hay which is used as winter feed for the animals.This means that they only need to buy pony cubes ,calf nuts and dried dairy food in small quantities. They sell some eggs and the calves will be sold for beef in the end.Two people work on the farm full time. It was a very interesting place to visit.
